On one fall afternoon Chie was at her usual eatery of choice, Junes, chowing down on her second piece of steak. Yukiko was beside her and Yosuke was on his break, sitting across from the pair with a gleam in his eye.

Swallowing her latest bite, Chie glared at her friend/pain in the rear Yosuke.

"Fine, I'll do it. But if I win you have to treat me to a steak buffet here."

Once Chie was sufficiently calmed down, Chie looked at Yukiko.

The next day come morning her mother was actually quite surprised at the hefty breakfast Chie had made for herself, of course the woman knew her daughter to have a large appetite (she always equated it to her child being a “growing girl”), but this meal was rather large even for her.

Still not wishing to pry she trusted Chie and soon enough saw her off…although she did seem to notice something seem different about Chie, the blonde girl had this new aura of proud confidence if she had to label it…still she trusted in her daughter…

On her way to school Chie smiled as she subconsciously balled up one of her fists only to open it up once more after getting a better feeling of the new amount of strength that flowed within her. One couldn't even begin to imagine the power she now possessed by just looking at her.

Like her shadow before her Chie had concealed herself in her usual everyday body shape, looking no more different then she had in days past, it was best to retain this form for a while so that no one would be the wiser to what had happen to her.

Passing a hand over her straight as a line stomach however did make her miss her bigger now more natural body…but there would be plenty of time for that later, right now it was best she stay in disguise and begin her plan of finding a worthy opponent.

Just outside the gates she began to wonder just how she was going to do such a thing, no one at Yasogami was as big as she was and being the competitive type that she was Chie didn’t want her fights to be complete squashes. No she wanted to prove herself and prove she had the strength the power to protect everyone she held dear.

So that begged the question who or what could contest against her?

Then an idea struck her, it was rather ridiculous in theory but maybe…

“My shadow was able to create meat products that were highly addictive and highly fattening I wonder if I can…”

She held that thought dashing toward any near location where she couldn’t be seen to well. Hiding behind a well-sized and heavy shade-giving tree Chie balled up her fist once more this time however instead of a mild flex she concentrated on food, more importantly she focused on meat in general.

She struggled for a while until at last she felt an object of sorts begin to form within her hand, upon completion Chie came to notice that she had seemingly created a patty with her mere thoughts! She smiled for it smelled divine, was obviously juicy-looking, and cooked to perfection.

It didn’t take her long to devour it down. It truly was perfect and was all the proof she needed to be convinced that she did in fact inherit her shadow’s newest ability. Admittedly she should have seen that coming due to the fact that like her shadow she could alter her weight and size to whatever she saw fit, she chuckled a tad for once poking fun at her own absentmindedness.

Regardless she now had a way of “crafting/molding” a challenger but who should get the ‘honor’?

Hanako was an obvious choice, the girl was already large but somehow unless she was truly desperate the often lazy and ill-tempered fatty wasn’t that high of a selection.

No Chie needed to use someone else. Maybe someone unexpected like Yumi or Ai, perhaps someone like Rise it would be interesting to see how she’d adjust to a bigger lifestyle, then again there was Naoto could her food-making skills actually sway a mind as strong as hers? Of course there was also Yukiko…

No! She shook away the thoughts of using her longest and closest friend no Yukiko wasn’t an option by any means.

Still class was starting and soon she’d have to decide on whom to seek out and use…

After having returned to the real world Chie headed straight for Ai’s home lucky for her she had found an officer who knew of the address she needed.

As she continued on over Chie wondered if it was alright to actually alter Ai? After all this time around she’d have to do while being fully aware of her actions. Could she actually go through with it, it wasn’t like before where her consciousness would slip into her dark side. This time there was no dark side to bring out some sort of sick mental pleasure this time she’d have to do it willingly.

“Why don’t my hands shake?” she asked herself wondering if perhaps her fears and already troubled mental state was causing her body to go entirely numb.

It was a hard decision to go through with but ultimately Chie came to realize that the only way she could repair the damage she had done to her friends was to push her fears aside and just this one last time alter the life of one last woman.

As she rang the doorbell Chie stood silent a million thoughts seemingly flowing within her mind.

After a short pause she heard the lock click the door then parted to one side revealing an uninterested blonde standing in the center of the doorway.

“Yeah, do I know you?” she asked a tad bit of annoyance in her vocal tone.

A real “charmer” Ai was…or at least that’s what Chie had overheard. Befriending the fellow blonde was going to be a lot tougher then it was with Yumi then again…

“Not really no” Chie stated softly her eyes looking away from Ai’s own.

“Then I guess you should leave, huh.”

With her hands planted firmly on her hips Ai was all but ready to slam the door in front of the girl before her.

“…but maybe you will in a bit.”

Before Ai could question much less react properly Chie launched herself at the surprised blonde closing the door with her foot after pinning Ai to the floor.

The frighten teen was about to scream in terror when she actually caught sight of the tears in Chie’s eyes! Her mind figured the worse suspecting that this girl must be criminally insane and on the run from the law.

“I’m so sorry, Ai-chan.” Muttered Chie pulling her hand back while Ai feared this was it her life was about to come to an end at the hands of some psychopath, who for some reason was a lot heavier then she appeared to be…

Closing her eyes she awaited the chilling embrace of…an éclair being stuffed into her mouth?!

Wait what? Where was the gun shot, the butcher knife digging deep into her flesh and bones?

Instead she instinctively finished off the sweet treat gasping for air only to be met with yet another equally delicious snack forcefully enter her mouth!

Around the eighth éclair Ai’s vision began to blur as did her mind like the others before her something was happening to her memories and while powerless to stop the process she felt no pain instead her struggling came to stop allowing Chie to roll of the girl’s increasingly growing belly land on her side and sigh deeply.

Chie figured that Ai must have been a little more then hundred pounds to begin with but her quick stuffing was plumping her up to around two fifty possibly already closer to three hundred her added fatness spreading around everywhere equally giving the blonde a real butterball look.

It was a “small” gain compared to what she had done to the others but it was what she had in mind for now anyway. Lifting herself up to her feet she stared down at the trance-like look in Ai’s eyes the fact that this state of mind in the past had actually brought pleasure to her nearly made Chie rush to Ai’s bathroom, still she had to confirm her curious assumption.

“Ai-chan can you hear me?” Chie asked as the second blonde began to come around.

“Satonaka-san? Ugh what just happened did I randomly pass out or something?”

Interesting but she wasn't completely convinced so Chie decided to play along for a little bit longer.

“Um sort of it’s more like you accidentally tripped and banged your head on the floor. But lucky for you doesn’t look like it left you with any sort of bruise or a bleeding cut.”

“Oh” Chie chuckled rather awkwardly as she heard Ai curse under her breath. To her relief it appeared that Ai’s memories had in fact been altered to the point where the two of them at the very least knew who the other was.

Maybe they were even friends? Chie could dream right. In any case Chie assisted the now heavier blonde girl back up to feet.

“Thanks…sorry about that…” muttered Ai a bit of a blush born from embarrassment appearing on her plump cheeks. This surprised Chie a bit until she remembered how Souji had mentioned that Ai seem to have a hidden emotional side to her.

Smiling Chie gave the girl a quick pat on the back stating that there was no need to apologize accidents happen after all Ai reluctantly nodded in response.

Now with the ice between them had melted away Chie knew she had to move Ai over to the TV world best not to waste any more time. Getting her to look away for a moment Chie conjured up a box of doughnuts then handed them over to Ai the taller girl not even questioning where Chie had gotten them from.

“Um listen Ai-chan…we’re going to take a little trip in a moment but first I need you to leave a note to anyone that may come around the house maybe looking for you or whatever just say that you stepped out and will be back soon, okay.”

Ai nodded chewing away at a powdered doughnut.

It was a rough estimate but to Chie it looked like she could in fact squeeze Ai through the set in the living room. Looking over at the pleasantly plump blonde who had finished off two more doughnuts as she completed the task assign to her Chie was thankful she had yet to fatten up to an even bigger degree but she had to get her in now before Ai’s weight shot up too high…

As they traveled through the TV world Chie sighed realizing that in retrospect she could have just given Ai some of the special clothing she had made for herself and the fatten up ladies. Oh well what’s done is done and this way Chie could keep a better check on Ai’s continuous gaining.

The girl was still gorging away at the box of seemingly endless doughnuts each one adding more and more to her once thin frame (pushing her now close if not pass four hundred) as well as altering her mind so that this other dimension didn’t seem so strange to her almost as if Chie had already told her about it in a past encounter that obviously never actually occurred.

Now that they were back at the steak house Chie showed Ai in. The last piece had been gathered now it was finally time for Chie to set things right.

Chie turned her back on the Ebihara residence. "No. I refuse. I will not go back to destroying someone's life."

With that she walked back shaking her head, something strange was going on with her, her head felt foggy. "Going to deny your desire? It's not that simple?"

Chie realized who it was right away, she covered her eyes and shook her head. "No you were out, I beat you!"

"If you don't complete it...then you can't fix it, any of it, and then you too will be caught in your own web." The Shadow voice echoed.

"SHUT UP! I DON'T, I WON'T, I WILL NEVER GO BACK TO RUINING PEOPLE'S LIVES!" Chie shouted falling to her knees crying.

"Then all is lost, goodbye Me, you won't need to cry any longer. The truth will flee from you and you won't have to cry anymore." The Shadow's voice faded, and Chie clutched her stomach.

"Why now....f-food...starving..." Chie got up and walked slowly towards Junes, her head still foggy.

As she crossed the street a car's horn blared and Chie looked at it, she put her hands out without realizing it and stopped the car. "F-Food?"

The driver got out as Chie lifted the car over her head, turning it into a car shaped cake and downing it, the onlooker in shock and terror, Chie rubbed the frosting off her jacket. "So Amazing...my power."

Slowly Chie was losing control of herself as she made her way into Junes, her stomach still demanding more, it roared like a pack of beasts and stung like a hornet's nest, Chie's body was demanding food. "Fine, fine."

She walked into the Grocery department and started taking food and changing it into meat, candy, chocolate or whatever to add more calories to it, even going as far as changing the wrappers, bags and anything that covered the food, she began to pile it all in, people screaming at this bizarre and horrible sight. "Food is so good."

People ran out screaming, as Chie ate the Grocery department, ALL OF IT. She made her way to the electronics department. She walked into the TV world and back to the Steak House where she was met by a flustered Yukiko. "Chie! What's going on, the girls suddenly grew hungry....even...."

Yukiko was clutching her stomach in hunger as well, was it because of her eating of Chie's food earlier. "Yukiko...what are you talking about? We need to fatten up for the Sumo Tournament."

"C-Chie....what are you..." Yukiko saw the sincerity in Chie's eyes and it dawned on her, Chie had altered herself without even knowing. Her power grew to the point she couldn't control it because her desire can not be completed, the long haired beauty fell to her knees as she looked back, Yumi Rise and Naoto eating forming piles of meat in the Steakhouse as Chie lifted her friend up.

"Come on Yuki, open wide." Chie grabbed Yukiko and shoved food down her mouth, Yukiko rejected it by spitting it out.

"Yuki! Why are you being so rude!?" Chie was offended and Rise came up and held Yukiko.

"Geez Yukiko-Sempai, why are you being so mean to Chie-sempai's sweet, sweet, SWEET offer?" Chie tried again this time holding Yukiko's mouth closed forcing the Inn inheritor to swallow, within moments she felt pounds stack on, her stockings feeling tight.

"CHIE! DON'T!" She shouted but it was too late, Chie kept stuffing, within minutes the stockings tore and the skirt followed suite, and Yukiko blimped out more and more, slowly being altered like all the rest.

It was an easy choice, fatten Ai and everything would have gone back to normal, Chie forgot that pursuit of the truth meant risking so much more. The fate of the girls was that they'd keep fattening each other, over and over day after day. All because Chie refused to stuff one more person, however that wasn't all that Chie had done. That night of Chie losing her memories was a large storm, a big one that kept many people awake. Nanako Dojima being one of them she looked at her TV unable to sleep when she saw it, five girls four of which she knew stuffing themselves going 'Food is good, so good, amazing.' The words echoed in not just her mind but in that of every girl in Inaba that saw it.

Nanako walked downstairs and opened the fridge eating a cake she had made in class, it was good. Food is Good. The Story does not end quite yet though, this was just the end of the beginning.

She eventually stopped at around 3-4 tons, immobile, she was at this moment in time the fattest woman on Earth, and Chie LOVED it, smiling. Chie stepped forward, ready to act.

“Chie what are you…”

That voice, that vocal tone…Yukiko! No she should have been halfway home already what the hell could have brought her back here?!

“Yukiko” Chie muttered her dear friend’s name, unlike with Naoto and her earlier exchange with the raven-haired girl she was determined not to lose her cool this time around.

“Chie what is this? What’s happened to that poor girl? Wait I know her isn’t that Ozawa-san?”

“Yukiko I’m surprised to see you here.”

“Don’t change the subject, Chie! What’s going on here?”

Chie ignored the sudden rise in Yukiko’s voice simply tossing her hands into the air.

“It’s…a game, Yuki.” She stated eyes shut closed.

A game, really that was her explanation? Yukiko wasn’t buying what Chie was selling and now knew that it was good thing she came back to pick up a few things for the inn. This wasn’t Chie or rather this wasn’t the young woman whom she had grown up with and considered the best of friends. This was a different Chie one that was beginning to scare her.

“A game…that I was hoping to keep you out of…”

Yukiko gasped out loud as she watched Chie open her eyes to reveal her normal set gone and replaced with the twin orbs of a shadow!

“Chie!”

“This is all for me to see if I have the power to protect you and the others. But it was something that I never wanted to force you into.”

“But you’re content with doing whatever it is you’re doing to other women!” argued Yukiko trying to make an ounce of sense in what her friend was stating much less doing.

‘Oh nothing Sempai just hanging out and sharing a meal with Naoto-kun…’

The phone call with Rise earlier had just awoken her to the harsh truth of Chie’s words.

“You…you did the same thing to Rise-chan and Naoto-kun didn’t you, Chie?”

Well now the blonde was legitimately impressed and surprised that her dearest friend was somehow putting the puzzle together piece by piece. Of course that meant…no she couldn’t do THAT…Chie struggled holding back the temptation to fatten up Yukiko. She had made a vow to herself and no matter how much her power begged her to do so she wouldn’t allow Yuki to be mentally altered.

So instead she clapped a slow but steady pace.

“Very impressive Yuki, Naoto-kun would be proud of your deduction. Yukiko my dear friend it’s true what I said I didn’t want to get you involved in this but…”

Chie faded away! Her friend had actually faded away in the same way their shadows had! Sweet mercy what had Chie done to herself?!

Yukiko gasped after Chie had reappeared behind her locking the poor girl into a vice grip of sorts. Despite the height difference Yukiko had always been physically weaker then her blonde friend and now the difference in power had increased even further due to Chie’s new abilities. As it stood she had little to no chance of breaking the near submission hold the tomboy had her in.

“Please stop struggling Yuki. I made a vow to myself that I wouldn’t hurt you and I won’t I simply need you to know that I will never do to you what I did to them. They are part of the test you on the other hand are different you’ll never be like them.”

“Chie what’s wrong with you? What have you done to yourself? Why Chie why?” her questions were silenced as a finger pressed gently on her trembling lips.

“I told you I gave myself power. Real power Yuki but I have to test it out first and soon very soon I’ll see for sure if I’m strong enough to protect everyone I care for.”

Chie watched as Yukiko eyed her slowly nearly in tears no doubt worried for the mental health of her beloved friend.

“Don’t look at me that way, Yuki. I’m doing this because you’ve gotten too close to the truth and I can’t have that. I promise you what happened to Yumi-san won’t ever happen to you but until then…sweet dreams…”

Yukiko wondered what that meant she got her answer a moment later when Chie actually gave her a small peck on the cheek! Stunned beyond reason the young woman wouldn’t even have time to know if she enjoyed the press of Chie’s lips on her soft skin because her guard had now been lowered enough for Chie to strike her into a state of unconsciousness...

“Chi..Chie…why…” muttered Yukiko tears falling from her eyes as she collapsed straight into Chie’s awaiting arms.

Fighting back her own personal water works her eyes now back to their original state Chie stared mercifully at Yukiko’s fallen form. She didn’t want to do it but it was a better solution then fattening the poor girl up like she had done with the others. While she hated what she had done Chie held on to that one belief she’d never alter Yukiko in any way so this was the only way to subdue her thankful that she knew just where and how to strike so that Yukiko would fall unconscious but without any major injury.

She soon phased back in Yumi’s direction, with Yukiko still in her arms, Chie figured that the girl would no doubt soon come around once her memories were completely altered to better fit her new titanic size.

With Yukiko out cold and Yumi soon awaking from her mental “reset” Chie knew what her next step had to be.

She smiled as she felt over her skin, shivering a little at how soft it felt underneath her fingertips. I need to take some of you to school." With that she managed to squeeze four bottles into her school bag, and drank another one alongside breakfast for good luck. Chie didn't notice that her trademarked green jacket was bulging out in front of her as she began the long walk to school, or that the insides of her stomach seemed to slosh with every energetic step that she took.

"Hey! Souji-kun!" Chie greeted the silver haired boy as she drew up near him at the school gates, "What do you think, huh?" she twirled on a foot playfully to show off her smoother skin and lighter hair, "Do I look any different?" Souji blinked at her a little dazedly, before looking at his friend in closer detail. The sunlight was highlighting Chie's perfect skin, and making her hair appear even lighter than before. While she was a tom-boy at heart, Chie did look stunningly pretty in the right light, Souji realised.

Then his eyes fell to how Chie's stomach was pushing at the front of her green jacket, and he felt something stir within him. Her stomach had pushed out to look as if she were a couple moths pregnant, anyone else would have missed it, but he was drawn to it. He had to ball his hands into his pockets to stop himself from reaching out and touching it, his grey eyes continuing to rove over his friend. It was then that it hit him.

".. you tried to look different because of what I said about Yukiko?" Souji asked after a moment, watching as Chie's cheeks flushed a delicate shade of pink, and she looked away to the side, "Chie. Yukiko's pretty and has good skin but," he shrugged a shoulder, ".. she's no-where near as exciting as you." Despite her heart swelling at the compliment, Chie couldn't help but bristle a little at the insult to her best friend.

"You can't say that about your girlfriend," Chie insisted as she stamped her her, it caused her stomach to jiggle slightly, "Or my best friend! How can you-"

".. we broke up," Souji finished simply, cutting Chie effectively off mid-rant, "We just wanted different things. Besides," he moved closer, Chie ducked a little on realising the height difference between them, "There's more to a girl than having great skin." He leant down to kiss her, pushing Chie gently back against the wall, his hands ghosting over her bloated stomach. Chie squirmed a little at first, before feeling the sheer euphoria that rushed through her from those careful touches. She melted in his arms, her own curling up about his neck as he deepened the kiss between them.

As stated earlier Rise didn't even have to move from her location since "Her Senpei" (Souji) would always rush over to protect her in case she came under fire. Obviously she loved that the gray haired youth watched over her but eventually all that grateful protection was beginning to have a toll on Rise.

Rise wasn't a big sports fan, or rather while she didn't take part in any sport activities she still came to games belonging to the teams of the school, and politely refused taking Yumi's place in the Drama club when the raven haired girl and Souji asked her (the details of Yumi's departure were apparently personal to the girl so Rise didn't pursue any further...) so that left the former pop idol with a lot of time on her hands.

Time that she would use to tag along with Chie, and Yukiko at times, to get a bite to eat. Of course Chie burned through the calories at an alarming rate so she never seem to gain even so much as half a pound but not so for Rise who had a much less active lifestyle then the blonde tomboy...

So with all that said Rise found herself at the end of her small break shrugging at the weight she had put on. Truthfully it wasn't much 5 maybe 10 pounds at most, and if there was one tiny positive it had puffed up her figure a tad it wasn't much but she was a bit more curvier then she had previously been.

So maybe it wasn't a complete disaster Rise thought amusingly but she still knew she had do something about this before it could perhaps get out of control. Rise obviously didn't mind being a bit thicker but being a blubber ball was definitely out of the question.
1313.title: Life's a little too easy for a pop idol

choices: The trio have lunch at Chie's favorite steak serving shop
On the way one of the girls notices Rise's weight gain
13131.content:
Being the middle of the week meant there wasn't as much business compared to the week's end but despite that Rise was still thankful when she, and her grandmother, finished the last of the orders for the incoming customers.

The redhead was also glad no one had brought up her sudden weight gain, then again being behind a counter and in uniform must make it hard to take notice of such things. Rise sighed in relief just before spotting two familiar faces walk into her grandmother's tofu shop.

"Chie-Senpai, Naoto-kun!" exclaimed Rise with a friendly wave. The blonde and cap-wearing bluenette doing the same as they greeted their pop idol friend.

"Hey what brings the two of you over?" asked Rise generally curious.

"Well I was going to get me some lunch and ran into Naoto-kun along the way so I thought why not invite you as well, Rise-chan." Chie explained in moderate-sized grin.

Before answering Rise asked about Yukiko unfortunately Chie stated that the raven-haired girl was as expected busy at her family's inn thus unavailable to join them. Rise then inquired about the guys, the girl was interested in what Souji would think of her now, but Chie retorted that it be easier and faster just the three of them going. They could all have a huge lunch get-together on a later date however.

Understanding completely Rise accept the offer, though she vowed she wouldn't eat too much so her figure wouldn't inflate anymore then it had.
13131.title: A lunch date with Chie and Naoto

choices: Rise tries to go on a diet, but doesn't muster the will and keeps eating sweets
Rise goes on a green diet but doesn't realize Calories gained over burned
131311.content:
"Okay! Steak time! Steak Steak Steak." Chie said with excitement.

Rise came back changed into her usual attire. "Ready!"

The trio walked over to the store, ready to order up some steaks. "Everyone good with Streak Croquettes?"

"Fine with me." Naoto said.

"Yeah senpai that sounds fine." Rise said.

"Okay be right back." Chie said as the two sat down, they were silent for a bit.

"So Naoto I was wondering, how hard work would you say it is to fight the Shadows? I just stick on the sidelines and don't do much." Rise asked.

"Well consider I mostly use long range myself, I don't put forth as much effort myself. It takes a lot to withstand their attacks, and not to mention the armor we have to wear is somewhat heavy."

"Oh yeah, that must be pretty heavy too, wonder how Chie senpai is able to do all her stuff even with armor on."

"I still question Kanji, he...leaps 10 feet into the air with the armor on, have you seen that?" Naoto asked.

"Oh yeah, that's just insane." Rise said recalling the first time she saw it.

"Lunch is served." Chie said dropping a plate before each girl.

"So what are you talking about?" Chie asked.

"Rise was wondering how hard it is to fight shadows. I mostly use my gun and my Persona so I don't really know."

"Oh man leave it to the kicking girl to answer this question. Well it's hard at first moving around with armor, and sometimes I have to wear those heavy metal grieves. Not to mention just taking a hit from some of those bigger shadows and having to stand up after it." Chie said.

"Wow, I never realized how hard it was for you guys." Rise said.

"Yeah but I wonder, why are there Support Persona and battle Persona? Think there's a...Tactical Persona? Or hey how about a Stealth Persona?" Chie asked as the girls all ate ignoring her ideas, she focused on her steak.

Rise was doing her best to slow her eating down a little, not to eat too fast. She didn't remember something basic, that the more you weight the bigger your stomach, and as your stomach grows, it needs more to be full, Rise wasn't going to be full from this. "Say Rise why the suddenly interest anyway?"

"Oh it's nothing, I was just curious." Rise said.

The trio were finished as Chie went to get seconds. "Anyone else want seconds?"

"Not me." Naoto said.

Rise WANTED to say yes, she really did, but she'd seem like a pig then she had an idea. "Well I'm still a tiny bit hungry, so why don't you and me share senpai?"

"Okay sounds fair." Chie said, Rise dodged a bullet, once Chie got back the two shared, they finished off the Steak Croquette.

"That was a nice lunch." Rise said.

"I agree, thank you Chie-senpai." Naoto said with a content smirk.

"No problem, well I better get going, later guys."

"Later senpai." The two girls said.

"You hid your secret well Rise-chan." Naoto said.

"It's not hard to tell is it?" Rise said realizing what Naoto meant.

"Physically we can't tell, so I know it's unnoticeable it was your question that gave it away."

"Wow you really are an amazing detective Naoto." Rise said.

"Rise if you think you're gaining just cut out snacks or try something healthier."

"Hey that sounds like a good idea, thanks Naoto." Rise said getting up and walking away.


Once night came along Rise measured her waist and weighed herself, looking at the mirror. "Decreasing my sweet intake or eating some fruits and veggies would be good."

Rise tried to think which diet would suit her.
131311.title: The First Step.

choices: Rise finishes her candy but is still hungry for more...
Rise's startled when she hears the door leading to the roof suddenly open!
1313111.content:
In Rise's mind Naoto was right cutting back on sweets would ensure she didn't continue to gain but did she have the will and the desire to stay true to her word?

Rise continued to eye the mirror using her imagination made her reflection bloat out slightly, she had to admit it wasn't bad considering she had given herself a more hourglass shape but snapped back to reality when she thought about what the others might say...especially Souji.

He didn't seem too fond of the extra-large Hanako (not that she was friendly with anyone mind you) and Rise worried that her Senpai would no longer give her the time of day if she had a gut that rivaled the biggest girl in school.

A soft sigh escaped her lips she needed to diet or at least cut down on the snack intake. Of course things are never as easy as they first seem...

*SNAP*

Rise crunched away at a chocolate-heavy candy bar as she stood at top of the school roof. She sighed deeply, couldn't even make it a day without one piece of candy. Snapping away at another piece Rise wondered if this was how smokers felt when they couldn't go a single day without a smoke to puff away at.

Looking downward at her slightly pudgier uniform-covered belly Rise absentmindedly poked away at it. In a week's time she had added anywhere from five to possibly ten pounds! Thankfully she had plumped out in all the right places so her belly wasn't as noticeable that and her school uniform (along with work attire) did well in hiding the sudden poundage.

Lastly while her face as well as a portion of her exposed thighs did appear visibly fuller no one, from friends to classmates, seem to bring up the subject of potential weight gain. She figured people must be thinking that she's blossoming into her adult body but was rather surprised Naoto hadn't said a thing after all the girl was the one who was quickest on the uptake.

Maybe Naoto was just purposely being quiet about it...or maybe she had let the girl down after the detective had offer her advice. Rise hoped it was the former and not the latter.
1313111.title: Time to go on a diet...or not...

choices: Rise decideds to call it quits on candy, but fans keep sending them in
Rise tries to add the green diet idea, but candy+all those green=fat Rise
13131111.content:
Rise unwittingly finished her candy bar and blinked. "Oh man I'm still hungry too."

Rise sighed as she looked in her bag, she had another! She actually in her mind couldn't believe she put in a second candy bar without even realizing it! "I'm starting to think...I'm losing it."

She ate the candy bar a bit shocked, she finished but was surprisingly still hungry! "Nooo! No no no Rise get a hold of yourself! Diet Rise Diet!"

She shook her head but her stomach disagreed, she then remembered that her shoe locker kept getting sweets in it all the time, from fans and secret admirers, walking down she grabbed a square box of chocolates and headed back to the roof, eating the assorted goods. "One more won't hurt, too much...I guess."

Rise finished the box, now she was full, or at least for the next two hours.

After class Rise went to her shoe locker she stuffed all the candy, five candy bars, a bag of gummi bears, two bags of gummi worms, a bag of Home Ec made cookies and three boxes of chocolates all had cards attached to them. "Being popular sucks sometimes."

Rise headed home to start her shift, eating two candy bars along the way out of simple hunger, she walked in her grandmother at the front. "Oh Rise, you got some packages."

"I did?" Rise asked as her grandmother showed boxes of chocolates, of cookies and various other snacks from far off fans who wrote in 'Get well soon Risette.'

Rise sighed. "I'll, eat them later."

"Okay dear." Rise loved her fans, she really did, deep down she'd feel she's insulting them by throwing their gifts away her Grandmother put them in the fridge in the living quarters.

Rise got changed all while chowing down on another bar. "I don't know what to do, I want to diet but I don't want to insult my fans but not accepting their gifts."

While on duty Rise ate a chocolate from a chocolate box from time to time, people came and went, paying no mind to Rise's weight as they couldn't see it, after duty Rise went up to her room and examined herself in the mirror, she saw herself as Hanako, hideously proportioned fat, fish lips, cheeks crushing her face in. She wanted to shout but that would shock her grandmother. "Ohhh what am I going to do!?"

She unwittingly had eaten another candy bar, she was becoming more addicted then before! Rise sat down on her bed, she looked at her bra, it felt snug. "Least my bust isn't being ignored by my fatness."

She looked at the cookies made for her in someone's Home Ec she tried one, they were great, she had no problem eating them but she needed some milk, she went and got some and ate the cookies with some milk. "Maybe I'll drink my milk once I finish becoming a cow..."

Going back to her room Rise looked at herself once more, she tried on all her cloths to see what can and can not hide her fat, all the while eating yet another chocolate. "I'm going to get fat at this rate, I need to change my diet scheme,"
13131111.title: Just One...Two...Three....Ten More

choices: Rise's lost her weight! But Yukiko can't fit in her clothes anymore
Despite Yukiko's help during the day, Rise's night binges keeps the two gaining
13131112.content:
The door suddenly opened and Rise hid all evidence of food. "Oh Rise-chan, I didn't know you were up here."

It was Yukiko, she walked up to the pop idol who was looking worried. "O-Oh hey Y-Yukiko sempai, w-what are you doing here?"

"Well it was such a nice day I decided to come up and have lunch with Chie. You?"

"Oh ummmm same!" Rise giggled sheepishly.

"Rise-chan...are you ok? You seem a bit red. Are you getting a fever?"

"N-No it's just..." Rise sighed and showed Yukiko all the candy she had.

"I'm such a pig! I've been binging on candy so much I'm starting to put on weight! At this rate I'll be so fat you'll need a forklift to pick me up!" Rise began to tear up as Yukiko walked over.

"Rise, I'll help." Yukiko said meeting the Idol at eye level.

"H-huh?" Rise looked up as Yukiko took the candy and ate it.

"I'll follow you around until you lose weight and eat whatever snacks or extra food you get, I don't eat much anyway and I can always burn the weight in the TV World."

"Sempai...you'd...you'd do that for me?" Rise asked.

"We're friends aren't we? Besides you have lots of people who look up to you, as shallow as it is you need to look your best don't you?" Yukiko smiled.

"Thanks Sempai." Rise took out more candy bars from her bag.

"Rise-chan...why do you have...so much candy?" Yukiko asked as Rise whistled.

Yukiko began to eat the candy bars to prevent Rise from eating them. Would her friendship pay off or are two girls doomed now to gain more weight?
13131112.title: A Real Friend

choices: Rise finds someone peddling chocolate, she tries it and becomes addicted
Rise finds a large book in a garbage can, inside is amazing/addicting recipes
131312.content:
Once Rise got out she tugged her shirt down a bit as the girls waited and watched. "Ready!"

"Uhhhhh Rise-chan?" Chie blurted out.

"Yeah?" Rise asked tilting her head.

"Your...clothes look smaller...did they shrink in the wash?" Chie asked.

"Nooooo..." Rise said getting the hint.

"Chie-senpai, let's just go." Naoto replied wanting to change the tense mood set by Chie.

Rise walked behind the girls as Chie slowly moved her head to look back at Rise, she cleared her throat. "Ummmm Rise-chan..."

"Yes...Senpai?" Rise asked with a hint of hostility.

"How much do you want?" Chie asked as Naoto facepalmed.

"Why? Do you think I'm FAT...Senpai?" Rise asked with a hostile tone.

"Well...you have possibly put on some..." Chie started.

"WELL SORRY I'M NOT SOME KUNG-FU FREAK THAT NO GUY WOULD DATE!" Rise shouted as Chie stopped.

"Hey least I put my life on the line on this case!" Chie turned around, she saw Rise was about to cry, real tears.

"Ohh...Rise-chan I..." Chie started as Rise ran away.

"Senapi...why can't you keep your mouth shut?" Naoto asked.

Rise had run away from the two. She didn't realize it but in running away from one problem she'll run into a new one.
131312.title: Bringing it to her attention

choices: Rise suggests Junes in an attempt to walk excess weight off.
Rise feels sluggish so they go to the general store and get food there.
13132.content:
It was Rise's lunch brake, as she took off her apron she heard people walk in. "Sorry I'm on lunch break."

She turned around seeing Nanako and Souji. "Oh Nanko-chan, Sempai! I didn't realize it was you two."

"Rise-chan! Rise-chan! Big Bro is taking me out to lunch, and I want you to come with!" Nanako said tugging at Rise's clothes.

"Okay, since you want me to come with so badly I guess I'll come." Rise smiled, deep down she was worried because of the excess she had, but to make Nanako happy and to be with the Sempai she loved.

Souji said Rise could pick where they go. Rise's excess made her more tired so maybe go right next to the store? Or bite the bullet and walk to Junes?
13132.title: Rise's Folly.

choices: The trio run into Teddie, does he notice or mention Rise's weight gain?
They spot Yumi, working as a cashier, who mentions the lunch special...
131321.content:
The trip would take a bit longer but Rise figured going to and from Junes would surely do her some good maybe even knock off a pound or two. She did feel a bit lazier then usual knowing full well that the change in behavior came from the weight she had gain, she sighed contently however upon realizing that neither the boy nor child had taken notice of her slightly puffier form. It was actually a blessing that her current casual attire wasn’t so form-fitting.

In any case the trio continued toward the mega-store, Nanako skipping along happily while being hand-held by both Souji and Rise. Tipping her vision slightly over to the boy she loved a mild blush crept over her cheeks walking around as they reminded her of a happy family, stiffing a giggle upon realizing that while she may not become Nanako’s mother if she were wed her “big bro” she would surely be her aunt. The little girl already was like family to her so it wouldn’t exactly be too far-fetched…

Suddenly she blinked in surprised after Souji had asked if she were feeling alright, the boy had momentarily caught sight of her blush. She scrambled for an answer for just a little while before playing it off as the heat coming down on her…lucky for her he bought the excuse Nanako suggesting that Rise should buy a cap at Junes.

She smiled at the child while thanking her for her suggestion adding in that she’d keep it in mind…

Fifteen minutes later the threesome at last arrived at Junes. Rise to her credit was doing well she wasn’t exhausted perhaps it was because she was Souji and Nanako that allowed her to focus more on them rather then the trip and her weight.

In any case she, along with the boy and child, stepped right in heading straight to the food court.
131321.title: Junes plus excerise equals good, right?

choices: The Food's delicious! Rise goes for seconds, it's too good to pass up!
Rise and Yumi's meet eyes, twice? Then talk like  friends then...lovers?
1313212.content:
"Oh, Seta-kun!" Rise heard a female call Souji's name and stopped her mouth gaped wide open.

Souji looked to see Yumi, a friend from his time in the Drama Club. She was in Junes attire behind a register, the group walked up and Souji introduced the two ladies. "Oh Rise! I'm a big fan, you were my inspiration when I was in Drama club."

"Heh...thanks." Rise said sheepishly.

"So, are you two out here on a date?" Yumi asked, Rise blushed red but Souji said the two were just friends and the words seemed to take physical form and hit the girl.

"Oh, well it's a shame because then the new lunch Special would be perfect for you two. It's called The Lunch for Lovers. I haven't tried it yet but everyone whose eaten is say's it's simply super-humanly good." Yumi said as Souji looked at the price, compared to other meals it was cheap but contained more he wanted, and more then Nanako's small stomach could handle.

"I'll take it, I don't want to burden your wallet senpai." Rise said, even though Souji was rich thanks to their regular trips to the TV World.

Souji nodded, he ordered a cheeseburger for him and Nanako and the Lunch for Lovers. Yumi nodded and rung up their amount and got them their orders as soon as she could. "Well time for my lunch break too. Mind if I sit with you guys?"

Rise was too busy looking at her tray to notice, a thick sandwich containing ham, cheese, lettuce, tomato, 5 slices of each! Next to that was a small bowl of fresh ramen, and to the other side was a bag of chips. Souji said it was okay and asked Rise, Jury was still out as she worried about eating the whole thing. Yumi came from behind with a tray carrying the same lunch as the pop idol, leaving the money for it by the Register for the person to take her shift.

The now group of four sat down. Rise sighed as she undid the sandwich, she knew she had to eat it to not waste it. She took a bite, is it really tasty beyond belief? Is there a reason why it's designed for Lovers?
1313212.title: The Lunch Special for Lovers

choices: Rise thinks it's a dream, the next day she eats more then usual unknowingly
Rise decides she is sick of dieting and eats, finding she likes her new softness
13133.content:
That night Rise was sound asleep, tossing and turning she had a dream where she was so fat that she couldn't get through the doors. "G-Guys! Help me!"

She was calling to her friends who were standing behind her. "Geez Rise, way to let yourself go."

"Yeah pig, can't believe this is what you are deep down." Yosuke said.

Everyone began to walk off and even Souji shook his head before walking away. "S-SENPAI! DON'T LEAVE ME!"

The large blubbery Rise cried only becoming bigger and bigger, Rise woke up from the dream panting. "It was...just a dream..."

Rise slowly began to nod off, not hearing the rain begin. There was no rain scheduled for tonight, but even the weathermen aren't perfect. Slowly Rise heard the sounds of munching and eating and opened her eye before the other followed. "W-what?"

On the midnight channel there was a clear image, a massive red haired pigtailed girl in a Yasogami high uniform eating mass amounts of food with a smile on her face, Rise rubbed her eyes for a good two seconds before the image was gone. "Was that...my shadow? No it couldn't have been, everyone beat my Shadow. Plus that was a HUGE person, her breasts were even bigger then my head, and she was as wide as if five of me stood side by side. No way could it be me."

Rise sat up on her bed thinking. "What if it was though? I have been eating a bit more lately, could my Shadow be saying something? I'm so confused. Could it be...I want to gain weight? I've been on a strict diet for so long, maybe I want some freedom with my food."

Rise debated on if she was dreaming the whole thing or that it was true and what it meant. Rise had two options, one was believe it was all a dream and simply ignores it. Two is try and see if maybe she does in fact want to binge on food and try eating more to see why her Shadow looked happy.
13133.title: The Surprisingly Super Sized Star

choices: Skip to Rise having a much larger then usual lunch
Skip to lunch where Rise is invited to join her friends on the rooftop
131332.content:
Sighing for a bit Rise laid back upon her bed. Listening to the rainfall while staring at the ceiling above she ultimately came to a decision.

She was on hiatus, had put on a few pounds, and figured that the cruelty shown by her friends in her dream would not mirror reality Souji and the others were her friends after all no way would they abandon her just for becoming "pleasantly plump".

There was that and the quick vision of her shadow seemed strange to her. Despite the clear image it didn't say anything unlike the previous time instead it smiled and seemingly disappeared harmlessly. It puzzled Rise a bit, was the shadow simply trying to relay a message without resorting to the cruel intent from before?

As Naoto had explained, shadows worked off a human's inner desires but took them to an extreme degree so was it trying to tell her that somewhere inside her she wanted to gain and in the process would be happier?

Guess it wouldn't hurt she thought with a semi-smile.

Screw dieting and eating constant low-fat food, she'd break free and binge on whatever she wanted. No need to restrain herself now. Plus if her recent gain had meant anything she would put on the poundage in all the right places and she giggled imagining that Souji would really enjoy embracing a plumper curvier Rise.

Grinning like a cunning cat Rise went back to bed. In her mind Risette was about to get BIGGER then she ever was before...

The next morning came and Rise was actually surprised no one had phoned her about the midnight channel, Yosuke and Naoto were usually the first ones on the draw but this time nothing. Again she found her shadow's appearance strange had her friends all missed it somehow or was it just contacting her personally?

No clear answer came to mind so shrugging it aside as she changed from her night attire into her usual student clothing, of course it was a bit tighter then usual. Rise then went to get herself some breakfast. No more restrains she reminded herself.

If anything else Rise was a woman of her word. After scarfing down a plate filled with eggs, several pieces of buttered toast, strips of bacon, and two sausage patties Rise said goodbye to her amused grandmother. The elderly woman had never seen her granddaughter take in so much food at one time but figured she was a growing girl after all and it would help shape her more into that of a woman.

Rise exited her home/family shop poking away at her slightly bigger belly. She giggled at the sensation of how soft it was and how when done digesting it would puff up her body shape. Eying the local General Store Rise remembered the delicious candy the neighborhood children often bought that was sold there. She smiled just before entering the shop...

Rise chomped away at the piece of chocolate candy, as she finished she tossed the wrapper into a nearby trash can. Placing a hand on her belly Rise realized it had shrunk a bit her now tighter attire pretty much confirmed this. She estimated her morning feast alone added another five to ten pounds more on her. Given her attire it would be hard to make out, although she'd have to be a bit more careful with her skirt, and with a less puffy tummy no one should question her about her sudden gain.

Rise preferred to keep it that way for the time being.

'No need to tell anyone anything right now.' she thought just as the school bell rang.
131332.title: Rise decides to enjoy her new weight

choices: Rise heads to the Chinese Diner to get a snack before eating a big dinner
Rise gets with her friends at Junes where she eats on par with a hungry Chie
1313321.content:
Rise sat atop the roof carrying a larger lunch the usual, except that was just part of her meal, Rise also had another piece to her meal inside her school bag. She placed it all down, inside the box was some of her home made tofu, a large rectangular portion of rice with some pieces of fried pork inside, a smaller yet still large side of sushi. Inside her school bag was another bag, a paper one, with a fresh sandwich inside. "Time to dig in."

She ate the sandwich along with some of the fried pork, taking in two different types of meat with this, she then ate some rice along with the sushi. She giggled as she did so. "Man, I can't believe how free I'm feeling, I can't remember the last time I ever ate this much."

Rise stuck a sushi in her sandwich and tried eating it like that, she laughed almost choking as she devoured the weird combination. "Hmm..."

Rise wondered what her belly was like now, she undid her bottom portion of her school uniform and saw her belly was resting on her skirt. Poking it she laughed. "Feels like a pillow!"

Rise had a smile on her face as she continued on, buttoning back her attire as she finished her lunch. "THAAAAAT was one good lunch."

Rise was feeling extra perky now, perhaps she found a bit of enjoyment in her new weight, later in her class Rise started nodding off, bored with the teacher's English lecture. Rise had a dream similar to that of what she saw her Shadow doing, Rise was surrounded by aromatic and delicious food and she ate it all quite greedily and contently. "Miss Kujikawa..."

Rise woke up. "I know you young ladies like to dream about boys but please don't do it during my lecture."

"I...wasn't dreaming about guys though." Rise said, or so she thought, perhaps it was hidden deep away in her subconsious but the first meal before her in the dream was something Souji made for lunch and shared with her one day.

"Hmmm that food looked so tasty." Rise said, licking her lips and some hunger growing from all the talk of food.

Her stomach was in agreement, Rise wanted food as soon as class ended. Rise pondered where she would go today after school. A Beef Bowl sounded good to Rise. Oh but Junes has some tasty grilled steak. Decisions Decisions.
1313321.title: Growing Meals for a Growing Girl

choices: Rise makes a big but manageable dinner
Rise goes overboard! Can she finish it all?
13133211.content:
Rise once again decided to keep her friends in the dark about her sudden interest in gaining weight so hightailing it out of school as soon as the bell rang Rise skipped over toward the local Chinese Diner.

On the way she for the second time today stopped by the general store and picked up another piece of chocolate. She finished it quickly however hoping it wouldn't hinder her appetite. Tossing the wrapper away Rise took the extra precaution of shutting off her cellphone. No interruptions she thought plus no one had brought up her shadow so she figured she was in the clear anyway.

Rise arrived soon enough and smiled as she entered the restaurant. Before she knew it she was already working away at the beef bowl she had ordered. Finishing the bowl several minutes later Rise hid a small burp before patting her soft now flabby stomach, she was truly starting to love the feel of her doughy flesh.

So with an amused expression she ordered a second bowl. She got through that one just as quick as she had the firs she then gave her belly a bit of a quick rub to sued it from any pain. Content with her "light" snack Rise payed for her meal and exited out the door.

Later when she arrived back home Rise was surprised to see a note left to her by her grandmother. In short it stated that the eldest Kujikawa had left to visit a friend a few blocks down the road and since the day was rather slow closing up shop early wouldn't hurt sales in any way.

By luck it seemed that Rise had the place all to herself and that meant...

"Time to get started on dinner!"

She instantly went to work on preparing a hearty helping of food.
13133211.title: Rise heads to the Chinese Diner to get a snack

choices: Rise's size is making her better at cooking. Her food is now addicting, to women
Rise's size is making her strong, she beats, and eats a shadow all alone!
131332111.content:
Rise had put on her work clothes so she could get the familiar feel of cooking in her. She whipped up a large bowl of rice, an extra large block of tofu, and had a lot sashimi on a plate and plenty of Sushi on another. "There that should be enough. Time to eat."

Rise poured the rice down using the chop stick, after which she took a piece of her sushi with and ate that, squealing at how good she made it. "Delicious!"

She took some Sashimi and ate it, also having a smile of delight, then she wrapped her sashimi around her sushi and ate those together for a simply wonderful taste that she just loved and wanted more, so within minutes she had finished both of those meals, moving back to the tofu and Rice she took pieces of tofu and placed it in her rice and downed both at one. "This is simply amazing! I never would have had such a simple pleasure before!"

Moments away from her destination, Naoto continued to move along the edge of the creek towards the field that had been set for their meeting place. The detective was trying to keep an open mind so she could thoroughly analyse the info that she was about to hear from Marie and understand what these artifacts truly were, as well as why the Mitsuru and the Kirito Group would want such a thing. Finally reaching the field, Naoto saw Labrys already there, waiting for her and Marie to arrive.

"Hello Naoto-kun. Was Marie accompanying you?"

"Hello Labrys-san, and unfortunately, she was not. It seems as though the one who called us here is running late."

Before the robot could respond, there was a loud shaking coming from the ground. The earth from middle of the field began to shimmer and slowly disappear, revealing a staircase behind it, with Marie climbing up from it.

"You two, come with me."

The detective noted that Marie had become more serious over the situation than before. I don't like where this is going, she thought. Going down the staircase, the three girls eventually found themselves in a small room, almost like one from an ancient temple. Marie beckoned them to come to the middle of the room where she would explain herself. As they walked over, Naoto noted that there were what appeared to be three different pillars around the room, each holding an empty slot for something. Finally stopped in the middle of the room, the black haired girl began to speak.

"This is the room where the artifacts where meant to be sealed in. I know this because of the memories from Izanami from when I was one with her. As you know, the world of the Midnight Channel or as you guys call it, the TV world, reflects the collective human heart and is a place where Shadows, a being made from humans which carry their darkest desires, are the main denizens. However, what you probably don't know is that this world has been here for ages, changing shapes and names as time and technology has. Before TVs, mirrors were the most suitable way for a human to enter the world and this world wasn't called the Midnight Channel. Having said that, many shadows have been born here from humans in all different ages. However, there was one odd case in which a particularly unstable human with a immeasurable lust for power had not made a Shadow from their desires in this world, but a physical object instead. This object was a necklace, which you know as one of the artifacts. Like you said earlier, the primary ability necklace will give it's wearer power, but the form in which the power comes varies with the wearer. Anticipating that there could be bloodshed for an object such as this, Izanami decided to take the majority of power from the necklace and split it between two bracelets and initially sealed all three artifacts here. However, after some time, Izanami decided to entrust only the necklace to a being who served her and was ordered to move it away from this room, since if someone where to access this room somehow, all three objects would be there for that person to take and unlock the full power of the necklace. As time went on though, that servant ended up dying from a malevolent Shadow and the necklace's whereabouts became unknown. Now it seems as though someone found the necklace and was able to access this place and take the bracelets, unlocking it's true power. I noticed this yesterday when I felt the surge of power from all three artifacts and ended up joining you two to search for the new owner."

"This is quite a lot to take in at once." the detective said, pausing a bit before resuming, "Well, from what you've told me, I understand that this necklace is powerful, but is there something else you haven't told us?"

"Yes, there is." Marie said, "Like I said before, this necklace was made from an unstable human being, so the necklace can have malfunctions at times which can affect the wearer as well as others who have been affected by the necklace's abilities. These malfunctions usually lead to giving the wearer and/or the people who have been affected by the necklace more power than they wanted without being able to stop the flow, although I believe there have been other malfunctions of the necklace although I can't seem to remember what they were. Additionally, I cannot say this is true since none of the past wearers of he necklace have ever described anything of the sort when using it, but my theory is that these malfunctions are really the will of the Shadow from that unstable human who may reside inside the necklace. It is just a theory, however."

"It seems as though these artifacts are indeed a dangerous threat then." Labrys said.

"Indeed." Naoto said, "This info only confirms the threat that these artifacts give. Marie, thank you for giving us this info. This really has helped us with our investigation on the artifacts. We will find the wearer eventually."

"It's fine." Marie said, "I'm just glad that I can finally get that off my chest and take some of the burden off. If you guys find any more leads unto the whereabouts of the artifacts, let me know."

Chie paused for a moment as the red head handed over a spare apron she had lying around. Rise was right the two of them were so much bigger they had practically grown right out of their clothing and while the apron didn't cover completely it would have to do until she got around buying some new clothes.

Thanking her fellow muscled up friend Chie slapped on the apron around her thicker waist before heading for the door. She seemed so excited about her new muscles, Rise wished she could say the same.

It wasn't that she hated them far from it actually she felt strong far more empowered then she could ever recall, excluding the use of her persona, but what worried the young woman was the fact that she had ended up much larger then even her doctored photos portrayed her to be.

She wasn't sure what to do if she showed up to the photo shoot the way she was the idol was sure she'd be accused of using a steroid-like substance to juice herself with.

The worry nearly caused even someone as big as her to fall to her knees and weep her eyes out. She really needed someone to talk so grabbing her phone she speed-dialed a friend of hers...

"I see...so you and Chie-Sempai took this supplement to improve your muscle mass. Except you ended up overdoing so in the process."

Naoto Shirogane, the detective prince, mentioned as she noticed Rise's much larger size. The idol explained that she was desperate there was no way she'd meet the deadline without going a bit overboard.

"I understand that Rise-san but what you did was completely reckless. In a way you and sempai are lucky all that occurred was your muscles swelling many times over the effects could have been much worse."

Naoto instantly regretted her words as she noticed the idol's expression worsen.

"Rise-san...I'm sorry it's not that I don't understand I am your friend so I do but you really should have thought things through first. However you stated that you did all this for a fitness shoot did you not?"

Rise wasn't sure what Naoto was getting at but she nodded nonetheless.

"Well yeah but it was more of a stunning swimsuit size not something like this." Rise emphasized her point by flexing her power-upped biceps.

"Then why don't you make it about that."

"Hmm? What do you mean? A fitness...idol? A bodybuilding idol..."

It sounded so absurd yet was far from the craziest thing the young woman had experienced in her life.

It was crazy what would her agency think what would her fans and the general populace think? Yet the more she thought about the more curious she was about actually going through with the idea.

"Naoto-kun you might be on to something."

"Rise-san all I'm saying is that you should do what makes you happy. I'm sure if he were here right now he'd say the same thing."

They both knew who the smaller girl was speaking of and Naoto was right she was done worrying about the shoot and instead was going to turn it on it's head!

"You're right, Naoto-kun, and Risette is going to make history as the first bodybuilding pop idol!"

Naoto gasped as she suddenly found herself caught in the much bigger girl's grasp Rise hugging her tightly not to mention incredibly close to her larger chest.

Eventually she was released the two embarrassed, Naoto looking away to one side while Rise mildly chuckled, at the quick token of affection.

"Great job guys!" Rise Kujikawa gave her usual post battle speech with less enthusiasm that usual. Another day in the tv world, another day of her playing cheerleader and pointing out obvious weaknesses.

"Right.....ok guys lets go!" Teddie cheered, leading the group further into the tv world with his usual gusto.

"....Wish I could charge in like that." she sighed, lowering her head slightly. "Sure, my abilties are important....but.....I just feel so pathetic sometimes." Rise slowly followed, with most of the group not even noticing she'd been lagging behind.

It was funny. Rise thought, that despite her shadow being harder for everyone to defeat than nearly all the others, the abilities it gave her were support only.

"What? Think I'm holding out on you?" a sinister voice whispered in her ear.

Rise turned in shock to see....herself, staring at her. "Hiiiiiii." her shadow self sing songed. "Miss me?"

"You!....but....I accepted you! You shouldn't be here! You should be..." "You're Persona?" the shadow mocked. "I am....but I'm also part of you.....and I know what you're feeling."

"Just....just shut up!" Rise shouted. "You...." she began. "Not you?" the shadow muttered. "No.....you are...." Rise's bravado deflated.

"I am. You. And holding out on you..." the shadow taunted. Rise was taken aback. "What? What do you mean."

"I mean keeping you weaker than you should be. The Persona thing is just the tip of the iceberg. You have no idea how powerful I am.....or you could be." the shadow moved closer.

"P....power?" Rise repeated. "Oh yeah. I could make you strong, fast." the shadow winked "Irresistible"

Rise stared in shock. "All you need to do is....accept me. Completely this time." the shadow grinned.

"And before you ask. Yes. There's a catch. This won't be like you're persona magic show stuff. This would change you, inside the tv world...and out."

"So...this new power.....would stick with me outside?" the girl questioned. The shadow shrugged. "Probably. But hey. That's a risk you take. Maybe you could become a super heroine" It laughed. "Or just stay out of trouble. But either way, would you rather be the same weak little girl you are now?" Rise's shadow poked her in the chest.

Rise thought hard. Clearly this was playing with something she didn't totally understand....but......maybe, maybe it was she wanted all along. Or maybe the shadow was tricking her.

133321.content:
After hearing her shadow's offer, Rise was conflicted. She knew that Shadows were always a tricky type, but the offer of power was tempting. She always hated being the one cast in the sidelines while her friends were out fighting and risking their lives. She wanted to get in on the action and show her friends that she could protect them too! Besides, her shadow was here to help her become stronger, something she knew she wanted. Maybe her shadow really did want to help her. It would hurt to try, right?

"As long as there's no tricks and won't hurt my friends, I'll accept." Rise said.

"Wonderful!" her shadow exclaimed, "I knew you wouldn't refuse. Now all that's left is to shake my hand to show your acceptance."

Rise's shadow stretched her hand towards Rise. Rise looked somewhat hesitantly at her shadow's outstretched hand, as if reconsidering. No, she thought. I already agreed, beside if anything goes wrong, my friends and I will find a way to fix it. Rise slowly opened her palm as her hand moved towards her shadow's. She grabbed her shadow's hand and shook it, the dark aura from it spreading onto Rise's hand. Her shadow formed a cat-like smile as her last words were:

"Have fun with your new power!"

Her shadow then turned into a black mist, spreading all over Rise's body. Rise quickly thought that this was a mistake and that her shadow was going to do something horrible to her until the black mist around her body was absorbed into her skin. After checking out her body to see if anything had changed, which to Rise's relief had not, Rise thought about the extent of what she had just agreed on before remembering that her friends had moved on without her. Still on alert for any signs of change with her body, Rise ran after her friends.

After remembering the torture and suffering her Shadow had put her through, Rise decided that it was better off not trusting anything her Shadow had to say. Pushing the urges of power into the back of her head, Rise faced her Shadow.

"After what you did to me and my friends last time, you think I'll trust your lies? My answer is no, plain and simple." Rise said.

"Hmm, that's a shame, seems as though you have more restraint than I thought," her Shadow said, "but I'll be back with my offer soon, and by then, I'm sure that it will seem more... appealing to you. Until then."

With that, Shadow Rise's body started to shimmer with a dark aura and disappear.

"I don't need you! I can become stronger without you!" Rise shouted to the sky.

Rise didn't think that her Shadow would irritate her so much, but then again, it was a part of her so it knew what buttons to push, so to speak. Rise still couldn't shake off that urge to become more powerful that she felt after hearing her Shadow's offer. It's fine, she thought, I can go meet up with Chie later and start planning workouts with her to become stronger, I don't need my Shadow's tricks.

Speaking of her friends, Rise hadn't realized how far the gap had grown between her and the rest of them and started into a sprint to regroup with them. Little did she know, her Shadow had only teleported a short distance away and was observing her behind cover.

"Hmm, she thinks she doesn't need me to be stronger, how cute. I'll make her see the error of her ways. First, I'll need to show her how much she really wants power. Then, I'll show her how powerless she really is in her current state to protect her precious friends. By then, she'll be so desperate that she'll take the offer without a second thought. But how?" The shadow thought to herself.

A mischievous grin appeared on Shadow Rise's face as she got an idea.

"Who's up for a little competition?"

After sprinting uphill for what seemed like hours, Rise finally caught a glimpse of her friends. Rise stopped to catch her breath before realizing that her friends were looking at something. After her legs stopped feeling like they were burning, she walked over to their vantage point see what had caught the stares of her friends. Rise saw an enormous building that appeared to be twice the size of their school, Yasogami High!

"Woah, where did this come from?" said Yosuke.

"I'm not sure," said Teddie, "All this time in the TV world and I've never seen this place! What do you guys think, should we investigate?"

"Well, I'm down to explore! Who else wants to join?" said Kanji.

Yosuke, Chie, Yukiko, Teddie and Rise's heads all nodded to answer his question. Naoto, however, was uncertain.

"It seems like everyone but you wants to check out the place, Sempai. How come you don't want to?" said Rise.

"While I will admit that I am curious to investigate the area, you should all know by now that everything this world creates always has some sort of danger or mystery attached to it. As long as everyone's guard is kept up, I will join." said Naoto.

"Alright! C'mon guys, let's go!" Chie shouted.

With that, the group moved down from their vantage point and raced towards the building. Once they reached the entrance to the building, a small metal door, they could better examine the building's exterior. It looked very plain and unremarkable, almost harmless, but heeding Naoto's advice, they slowly opened the door, preparing themselves for any trouble awaiting them...

After opening the door, everyone slowly came inside inside, ready to call their Personas at a moment's notice. The inside of the building was pitch black, making it hard to see anything, even the person they were beside!

As if in answer, spotlights hanging from the ceiling started to turn on row by row, showering the inside of the building with light. The group squinted their eyes as the light was too bright. Behind the stage was a crimson red curtain, completely covering what Rise assumed would be a backstage. Rise then looked up at the ceiling, gasping as she could not see where it ended. All she could see was light coming out from them, so there had to be an end. Rise wondered how this could be before remembering that in the TV world, not all rules of the real world apply. Besides the stage, there was what appeared to be a small judge's table and rows and rows of seats behind the table facing the front of the stage.

Oh, are you all here for the competition?" said a friendly, familiar voice.

As the female figure drew closer to the group, they all realized that it was Marie! The group got on stage and met with her halfway across the stage.

"Hey Marie, how have you been?" said Yosuke, "We haven't seen you in awhile."

"Oh, I've been fine, thanks. Is Yu with you guys or...?"

Rise was the first to reply, "How come you want to see him so badly, Marie?!"

Rise and Marie were always bickering over Yu seeing as both had feelings for the silver haired boy. Whenever Rise heard Marie talking about him, it would immediately set her off. However, Rise was surprised when Marie replied: "Oh, I was just wondering, no need to get angry, Rise."

Rise was confused. Marie was being nicer to her than usual, and it was strange considering how cold she could be at times. Something seemed odd to her. Wanting to change the subject of the conversation, Yosuke spoke up and said, "Anyways, what is this place, Marie? Do you know anything about it?"

Afterwards, I was approached by someone to host a competition here. They supplied all the items that were needed for it: props, outfits and prizes too! Too bad there's only been a couple of sign-ups. We need a few more people to enter..." Marie replied.

(Authors Note: This is equivalent to around $1 000 USD... ish, I needed a big number with lots of zeros, just roll with it) As for the supplier, I was told that they want to keep it a secret until the competition, where they will reveal themselves."

A swimsuit competition, Rise thought, wow, we should join! Meanwhile, Teddie started to snicker.

"Hey, it's just like the time when Yosuke signed up the girls for the Beauty Pageant at school and I got to add a swimsuit contest as one of the events! Man, that was..."

Before Teddie could go further, Chie had kicked the small bear right in the face, sending him flying off the stage. As the bear recovered and was about to ask why he deserved that, he saw the death glares coming from Chie and Naoto, both who hated recalling that embarrassing event, before closing his mouth.

Immediately, Yosuke, Teddie, and Kanji all supported Yukiko's offer that the girls join, mostly because they wanted to see the girls in swimsuits again. Chie also agreed not only for her friends, but if she were to win, she could use the money for buying food, especially her favourite meat dishes. However, Naoto was a different case. Sure, after facing her Shadow, she had become more comfortable with her gender, but she didn't like revealing so much bare skin out in the open, especially with an audience. That was the reason she ditched the swimsuit portion of the Yasogami High Beauty Pageant. Then again, it would help Marie, her friends were also joining so she would not be alone on stage and the money was a good incentive. If she managed to win, she could donate it all to the Police Department to help with future situations.

After thinking about the pros and cons, Naoto finally made her decision.

Thinking over the day's events, Rise decided that maybe she was just being a little paranoid. A lot did happen today, thought Rise, thinking of her and her Shadow's conversation earlier, so maybe it was just me being on edge. Besides, everyone else thought everything was alright, even Naoto! If something was amiss, the ace detective would usually be the first to know about it. Maybe all this paranoia will come off of me with a good night's sleep, she thought. With that, Rise headed home to rest up. Tomorrow was going to be a big day.

After getting a good night's sleep and waking up bright and early, Rise got herself ready and planned to meet with the other girls at Junes so they could enter the TV world together for the competition. By the time the girls had met with each other and got to Junes, it was already 10:30 am, so they needed to get a move on! Entering the TV world, the girls went over to the building. Coming through the entrance, they were greeted by Marie.

"Hey guys, you're right on time! That's great! Why don't you guys go backstage and get changed? Our supplier gave us a big selection of swimsuits to wear so you can pick whichever you like!"

Rise was starting to get suspicious again. Forget Marie's behaviour towards her, Rise never saw Marie being so nice or polite to anyone like this before! After going backstage with her friends, once again she asked if any of them noticed anything strange about Marie but again to Rise's surprise, none of them detected anything. Rise wondered why she was the only one worrying about this. It were as if all her friends senses' were dulled... No, that's crazy, she thought, For now, I'll just worry about the competition.

Heading backstage, Rise saw that Marie was not lying when she said that there were a lot of swimsuits. There were what seemed like hundreds upon hundreds of swimsuits of all different shapes, colours and styles. It was almost like a store just dedicated to them! Besides that, the only other thing backstage was a couple of dressing rooms to get changed. Rise wondered what type of person this supplier was to afford all of this, and why? She was pretty sure all these swimsuits together would cost more than the grand prize, so why was this supplier giving so much into the props and clothes instead of the prizes? Again, it seemed like Rise was alone in wondering about these questions as her friends did not seem to notice. Just something else to figure out after the show, thought Rise. After picking an orange two - piece swimsuit, Rise went into one of the changing rooms and changed outfits. After coming out, Rise noticed that all her other friends were still choosing. Marie came backstage and told them that she could help the rest of the girls with picking and changing in their swimsuits. Finally, after everyone had changed, Rise went over to talk with the girls and see what they choose. Chie was wearing a yellow and green two - piece swimsuit while Yukiko was wearing a similar swimsuit except that the colour was pink and white and her swimsuit's bottom had small red ruffles attached to it's waistband in addition. Naoto's choice was a bit different. Seeing as she wanted to show as little skin as possible, she opted for a deep blue school swimsuit which only revealed her head, neck, arms and legs.

"Wow, you guys all look great!" said Rise.

"Thanks Rise! You look awesome as well!" said Chie.

Yukiko giggled, almost going into one of her laughing fits. "I think you're fine, Naoto. You look so cute in that swimsuit!" she replied after calming down.

"Yeah, Marie told us that yesterday!" said Yukiko.

"Although we weren't given a specified number, we can assume there is at least one other contestant based on Marie's info. The question remains as to who it is."

The group was curious as to the other contestant was when a voice rang out from behind them.

"C'mon ladies, the competition starts in a couple of minutes. Let's get set up!"

"Ok, thanks Marie." was all Rise replied back before getting into her position.

Everything that Marie said to her felt unnerving to her for some reason, and Rise thought she saw her smiling as she was walking away.

Focus on the competition, Rise thought as she started doing poses to impress the judges. As see looked over to her friends to see how they were doing, she stopped moving as she saw all of them clutching their stomachs, sweat forming on their faces as they looked like they were in immense pain.

Now the gap of strength between her and her friends had grown even bigger, and Rise wasn't sure how she could catch up!

"You know, Rise, if you want power, you could always take my offer..."

"You! You're...!" Rise shouted.
